tn.ref: Shaharaim ... Jobab ... Zibia ... Mesha ... Malcam ... Jeuz ... Shachia ... Mirmah ... Abitub ... Elpaal
By his wife Hodesh, Shaharaim became the father of
tn.text: AT: "Shaharaim and his wife Hodesh had the following sons:"

tn.ref: Elpaal ... Eber ... Misham ... Shemed ... Beriah ... Shema

tn.text: The information in [[:en:bible:notes:1ch:08:14|8:17-18]] has been rearranged so its meaning can be more easily understood. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_versebridge]])

The information in [[:en:bible:notes:1ch:08:19|8:19-21]] has been rearranged so its meaning can be more easily understood. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_versebridge]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

The information in [[:en:bible:notes:1ch:08:22|8:22-25]] has been rearranged so its meaning can be more easily understood. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_versebridge]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: These were heads of clans and leaders
tn.text: The words "heads of clans" and "leaders" mean the same thing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: The father of Gibeon, Jeiel, whose wife's name was Maacah, lived in Gibeon
tn.text: Here "father of" refers to Jewels' status as the leading person in the city of Gibeon. AT: "Jeiel, the leader of Gibeon, lived in Gibeon. His wife's name was Maacah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Jeush the second, and Eliphelet the third
tn.text: AT: "Jeush the 2nd son, and Eliphelet the 3rd son" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: They had many sons and grandsons, a total of 150
tn.text: AT: "They had a total of one hundred fifty sons and grandsons"
